oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Special weekly report of transportation

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Wainwright, William Alonzo, 1832-1904; United States -- Army -- Quartermaster Corps; Stoneman, George, Jr., 1822-1894; Gillem, Alvan Cullem, 1830-1875; Transportation, military; Railroads; Refugees; Prisoners of war
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Special weekly report of transportation for week ending September 30, 1865, by William Alonzo Wainwright Assistant Quartermaster, Department of Tennessee, in Knoxville, Tennessee. Persons listed on form include: Mr. and Mrs. W. M. Polk (destination Bristol, Tennessee, transporation ordered by George Stoneman); Sheldon Toomer and servant (destination Petersburg, Virginia, paroled prisoner); G. Brooks, Wife and 2 daughters (destination Mossy Creek, Tennessee, refugees, transportation ordered by Alvan Cullem Gillem).
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States -- Army -- Quartermaster's Dept.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: William Alonzo Wainwright, United States Assistant Quartermaster Records, 1861-1870
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Travel was strictly monitored and curtailed during the war and into the post-war period. Both military personnel and civilians were required to apply to the Quartermaster's Department for authorization to travel by train.
